message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.OS

This paper discusses the security and privacy implications of Apple's implementation of Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) protocols in recent versions of iOS. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves system-level analysis and reverse engineering of the BLE protocol, which suggests the possibility of cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.OS (Operating Systems) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the transmission of data over wireless networks, which could fall under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-category. Finally, the paper also involves the analysis of device identification and tracking, which could be related to cs.MM (Multimedia).
